subject: RE: [junit] JDK 1.5 annotations a la nUnit
msgSnippet: ... This looks very interesting. I ve been looking at http://raibledesigns.com/wiki/Wiki.jsp?page=AppFuse which roll up a lot of crud tests for free. Something
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: pope [mailto:alexandru.popescu@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, January 26, 2005 12:00 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] JDK 1.5 annotations a la nUnit
>
> -----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
> Hash: SHA1
>
> [quote ezra_epstein::on 1/26/2005 4:46 AM]
> |
> | I did some work with .NET a while back. ...
> |
> | I'm wondering, now that annotations have been added...
>
> TestNG is already doing this... not exactly a backport of the
> port of JUnit, but it is proposing
> some changes to the traditional JUnit solution.
>
> You can find more here: http://beust.com/testng

This looks very interesting. I've been looking at
http://raibledesigns.com/wiki/Wiki.jsp?page=AppFuse which roll up a lot of
crud tests for free. Something like this might make it easier to do
automatic generation of tests (or at least their skeletons?

thanks
